 Simple control commands. More...

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum RemSimpleControlCommand

Simple control commands.

Some of these commands are used in combination with a numeric parameter. In that case the meaning of the parameter is explained too.

See also:
RemPPCallbacks::simple_ctrl
Enumerator:
REM_SCTRL_CMD_PLAYPAUSE 
REM_SCTRL_CMD_STOP 
REM_SCTRL_CMD_RESTART 
REM_SCTRL_CMD_NEXT 
REM_SCTRL_CMD_PREV 
REM_SCTRL_CMD_JUMP  Jump to a specific position in playlist or queue.

Param:

  • > 0 : position in playlist
  • < 0 : position in queue
So 1 (resp. -1) denotes the first position in the playlist (resp. queue) -- this is similar to RemPlayerStatus::cap_pos.
REM_SCTRL_CMD_VOLUME  Adjust the volume.

Param: the volume in percent

REM_SCTRL_CMD_RATE  Rate the currently active plob.

Param: the rating value with 0 <= rating <= RemPPDescriptor::max_rating_value

REM_SCTRL_CMD_VOTE  FUTURE FEATURE.
REM_SCTRL_CMD_SEEK  FUTURE FEATURE.
REM_SCTRL_CMD_REPEAT  Set the repeat mode.

Param: the repeat mode (see RemRepeatMode)

REM_SCTRL_CMD_SHUFFLE  Set the shuffle mode.

Param: the shuffle mode (see RemShuffleMode)

REM_SCTRL_CMD_COUNT
